Methods¶

Histfactory.__init__(workspace_folder=None, name=None, regions_folders_base_name='Region', bkg_files_base_name='BkgOnly', patch_files_base_name='patch', output_folder=None, input_file=None, verbose=True)[source]¶

The Histfactory object can be initialized in two different ways, depending on the value of the input_file argument.

  • input_file is None (default)

    All other arguments are parsed and saved in corresponding attributes. If no name is available, then one is created. The private method Histfactory.__import is called to import the workspace at folder workspace_folder. This method also saves the object through the Histfactory.save method. See the documentation of the aforementioned methods for more details.

  • input_file is not None

    The object is reconstructed from the input files through the private method Histfactory.__load If the input argument output_folder is None (default), the attribute Histfactory.output_folder is set from the input file, otherwise it is set to the input argument.

  • Arguments

    See class Arguments documentation.

  • Creates/updates files

    • Histfactory.output_h5_file (only the first time the object is created, i.e. if input_file is None)

    • Histfactory.output_log_file

Histfactory._Histfactory__check_define_input_files()¶

Private method used by the Histfactory.__init__ one to set the attributes corresponding to input files

  • Histfactory.input_h5_file

  • Histfactory.input_log_file

depending on the value of the Histfactory.input_file attribute.

Histfactory._Histfactory__check_define_output_files()¶

Private method used by the Histfactory.__init__ one to set the attributes corresponding to output files

  • Histfactory.output_h5_file,

  • Histfactory.output_log_file

depending on the value of the Histfactory.output_folder attribute. It also creates the folder Histfactory.output_folder if it does not exist.

Histfactory._Histfactory__check_define_name()¶

Private method used by the Histfactory.__init__ one to define the Histfactory.name attribute. If it is None it replaces it with "model_"+datetime.now().strftime("%Y-%m-%d-%H-%M-%S.%fZ")[:-3]+"_histfactory", otherwise it appends the suffix “_histfactory” (preventing duplication if it is already present).

Histfactory._Histfactory__import(verbose=None)¶

Private method used by the Histfactory.__init__ one to import an histfactory workspace. The method scans through the regions folders in the Histfactory.workspace_folder, determines all background and signal (patch) files and generates the attribute Histfactory.likelihood_dict. After creation, all items in the dictionary, corresponding to all available likelihoods, have the flag load_model=False.

  • Arguments

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

Histfactory._Histfactory__load(verbose=None)¶

Private method used by the Histfactory.__init__ one to load a previously saved Histfactory object from the files

  • Histfactory.input_h5_file

  • Histfactory.input_log_file

The method loads, with the deepdish package, the content od the Histfactory.input_h5_file file into a temporary dictionary, subsequently used to update the Histfactory.__dict__ attribute. The method also loads the content of the Histfactory.input_log_file file, assigning it to the Histfactory.log attribute.

  • Arguments

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

Histfactory.import_likelihoods(lik_numbers_list=None, progressbar=True, verbose=None)[source]¶

Imports the likelihoods lik_numbers_list (if the argument is None it imports all available likelihoods) adding to the corresponding item in the Histfactory.likelihoods_dict dictionary the items corresponding to the keys “model”, “obs_data”, “pars_central”, “pars_bounds”, “pars_labels”, “pars_pos_poi”, “pars_pos_nuis”, and changing the value of the item corresponding to the key “model_loaded” to True. If this value was already True the likelihood is not re-imported. When using interactive python in Jupyter notebooks if progressbar=True the import process shows a progress bar through the ipywidgets module.

  • Arguments

    • lik_numbers_list

      List of likelihoods numbers (keys of the Histfactory.likelihood_dict dictionary) to import. The dictionary items corresponding to the keys lik_numbers_list are changed while all others are left unchanged. This allows to only quickly import some likelihoods corresponding to interesting regions of the parameter space without having to import the full workspace. If lik_numbers_list=None all available likelihoods are imported.

      • type: list or None

      • default: None

    • progressbar

      If True and if the length of lik_numbers_list is bigger than one, then a progress bar is shown.

      • type: bool

      • default: True

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

  • Updates file

    • Histfactory.output_log_file

Histfactory.save_log(overwrite=False, verbose=None)[source]¶

Saves the content of the Histfactory.log attribute in the file Histfactory.output_log_file

This method is called by the methods

  • Histfactory.__load with overwrite=True and verbose=verbose_sub

  • Histfactory.get_likelihood_object with overwrite=True and verbose=verbose_sub

  • Histfactory.import_likelihoods with overwrite=True and verbose=verbose_sub

  • Histfactory.save with overwrite=overwrite and verbose=verbose

  • Arguments

    • overwrite

      If True if a file with the same name already exists, then it gets overwritten. If False is a file with the same name already exists, then the old file gets renamed with the utils.check_rename_file function.

      • type: bool

      • default: False

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

  • Creates/updates file

    • Histfactory.output_log_file

Histfactory.save(lik_numbers_list=None, overwrite=False, verbose=None)[source]¶

The Histfactory object is saved to the HDF5 file Histfactory.output_h5_file and the object log is saved to the json file Histfactory.output_log_file. The object is saved by storing the content of the :attr:Histfactory.__dict__ <DNNLikelihood.Histfactory.__dict__> attribute in an h5 file using the deepdish package. The following attributes are excluded from the saved dictionary:

  • Histfactory.input_file

  • Histfactory.input_h5_file

  • Histfactory.input_log_file

  • Histfactory.log (saved to the file Histfactory.output_log_file)

  • Histfactory.verbose

In order to save space, in the :attr:Histfactory.likelihood_dict <DNNLikelihood.Histfactory.likelihood_dict> the members corresponding to the keys lik_numbers_list and that have been imported are saved in the dic["model_loaded"]=True “mode”, while the others are saved in the dic["model_loaded"]=False”mode”. See the documentation of :attr:Histfactory.likelihood_dict <DNNLikelihood.Histfactory.likelihood_dict> for more details.

  • Arguments

    • lik_numbers_list

      List of likelihoods numbers (keys of the :attr:Histfactory.likelihood_dict <DNNLikelihood.Histfactory.likelihood_dict> dictionary) that are saved in the dic["model_loaded"]=True “mode”. The default value None implies that all members are saved with all available information.

      • type: list or None

      • default: None

    • overwrite

      If True if a file with the same name already exists, then it gets overwritten. If False is a file with the same name already exists, then the old file gets renamed with the utils.check_rename_file function.

      • type: bool

      • default: False

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

  • Creates/updates files

    • Histfactory.output_h5_file

    • Histfactory.output_log_file

Histfactory.get_likelihood_object(lik_number=0, output_folder=None, verbose=None)[source]¶

Generates a Lik object containing all properties needed for further processing. The Lik.logpdf method is built from the pyhf.Model.logpdf method, and it takes two arguments: the array of parameters values x and the array of observed data obs_data. With respect to the corresponding pyhf.Model.logpdf method, the logpdf in the Lik object is flattened to output a float (instead of a numpy.ndarray containing a float).

  • Arguments

    • lik_number

      Number of the likelihood for which the Lik object is created.

      • type: int

      • default: 0

    • output_folder

      If specified is passed as input to the Lik, otherwise the Histfactory.output_folder is passed and the Lik object is saved in the same folder as the Histfactory object.

      • type: str

      • default: None

    • verbose

      Verbosity mode. See the Verbosity mode documentation for the general behavior.

      • type: bool

      • default: None

  • Returns

    Lik object.

  • Creates files

    • Lik.output_h5_file

    • Lik.output_log_file

  • Updates file

    • Histfactory.output_log_file

Histfactory.set_verbosity()¶

Method inherited from the Verbosity object. See the documentation of Verbosity.set_verbosity.
